p: P, Mg, and K are essential minerals to human health. They have been suggested to be potentially protective against obesity and metabolic disorders [ 15, 16, 17]. Previous studies showed other processing methods that can minimize mineral losses. Alajaji et al. reported that microwave cooking resulted in a great retention of minerals in chickpea grains, followed by autoclaving, then boiling [ 19]. Germination of grain legumes (chickpea, mungbean, and cowpea) followed by pressure cooking or microwaving for optimized times appeared to enhance the availability of minerals to a significant level [ 35].
